Description: Ostracon, large section of the upper-body of a pale-red pottery jar, the fabric is greyish in section, the exterior, the lower section of which is ribbed and elaborated with cord-marked decoration at the shoulder, is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of two lines of incised Coptic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394293) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394293)
